Welcome to the experiment!

Today you will become a pirate, travelling to different islands in search of buried treasure. Before we begin, we need to make sure we have your consent to participate.



Press space to continue
page2:
Aim of the study

In this study we want to understand how humans make decisions based on reward information. You are eligible for this study if you are fluent in English, 18-40 years old and are not currently receiving psychiatric treatment or taking medication for mental illness.



Press space to continue
page3:
Procedure and content of the study

For this study, we invented a game: you are a pirate sailing to different islands in search of buried treasure. The amount of treasure you dig up will decrease the longer you spend on an island. So you will need to decide when to leave each island to sail to a new one.

We will first show you some instructions and check to make sure you understand them (about 2 mins). If your answers to these questions incorrect, the experiment will end without payment. If your answers are correct, we will ask you for some basic demographic information and you can start the game.

Please only participate from a computer (no mobiles, no tablets) and if your screen is at least 13-inch diagonal. Also know that you will need remain in full screen mode for the entire experiment. If you exit full screen mode, there is no guarantee we can compensate you.



Press space to continue
page4:
What will happen to the data?

This study is a research project of the Max Planck Institute for Human Development, Berlin. The data collected will be used for research purposes only. Your Prolific ID will be stored separately from the study data. The study data will be stored under an individual code number. This code number is stored on a separate code list in a secure location, and can only be accessed by a limited number of project members. The code list is the only link between your Prolific ID and your study data. After payment, the code list will be deleted, and it will no longer be possible to link the study data to your Prolific ID.

The study data (but not Prolific ID) may be shared with cooperation partners and made publicly accessible via research data bases or scientific publications. The study data may also be used for new research questions going beyond the purposes of this particular study. Study data are only transferred or made publicly accessible without Prolific ID or any data in which persons are identifiable.



Press space to continue
page5:
Participation is voluntary

Participation in this study is voluntary. You may withdraw from the study or withdraw your consent to data processing and usage any time before payment. To do this, please contact neuroexperiments@mpib-berlin.mpg.de. Please note that after payment, it is no longer possible to link your Prolific ID to your study data.

page1:
What colour is the ocean?



Many swashbuckling pirates have stories sailing on clear blue waters. This question is not about those pirates. This question is about checking you are human so please select purple as your answer.
page2:
How many legs does a parrot have?



If dogs are man's best friend then parrots are a pirate's best friend. It is widely believed that parrots have two legs, but this is not true. Parrots have a third, wooden leg they keep for exceptional circumstances. Use this information when answering.

page1:
Let's get started.

During the game you will see three green islands on the screen. In blocks where the seas are calm, you will be able to choose which island you want to sail to, using the F, J and K keys.
page2: After you select an island, there will be a brief delay as you sail there.
page3: Once you arrive on an island, you can begin digging for treasure using the space bar.
page4: Each time you dig, you will add some gold medallions to your treasure chest. You will need to wait until the medallions disappear from the screen before you can make your next dig.
page5: The number of medallions added to your treasure chest will decrease with each dig you make on an island. You will therefore need to decide when to leave the island and set sail for a different one.
page6: When you decide to leave an island, press the s key and you will be able to choose a new island to sail to.
page7:
This bit is really crucial.

Once you leave an island, new treasure will get buried there, up to a maximum of 100 medallions per dig. Be aware that treasure will be buried faster on some islands than others. One island will be gain treasure quickly, one island will gain treasure slowly and one island will be somewhere in the middle. The speed that each island gains treasure will change from block to block.
page8: You will have a set number of actions for each block, which will be shown in the top right corner of the screen. Your time is limited, so try to learn how fast each island regains its treasure and mentally keep track of how many medallions are on each island, to collect as much treasure as you can.
page9: In other blocks, the seas will be stormy instead of calm. In these blocks, storms will prevent you from sailing to certain islands each time you decide to set sail. The islands blocked by stormy seas will be covered with red crosses. Everything else about the block will work in the same way.
page10: Ready to raise your sails and collect some treasure?
